column4: Hi! I'm SSH-ing my computer at home and I need to mount a windows partition... Can someone help me?
install and use smbmount
This is non graphical?
yes, it's a command line utility to mount samba shares
And I'm not aiming at distant mounting, you can imagine I'm stuck with console and no X....
Just like my windows partition (on the same computer!) can be mounted from inside Ubuntu
like I said, use smbmount ;)
Ok, thanks
Packet doesn't exist
sorry, it's provided by the smbfs package
Well, if I had figured out earlier that it was /dev/sda1 and NOT /dev/hda1....
are you using some kind of USB hub ?
No, right into the computer
have you tested the speed wit hdparm -t ?
The speeds I mentionned earlier are those given by hdparm
ah ok :\
No idea then?
Could it be a swap or CPU or RAM or linear combination of the aforementionned?
...issue?
not likely, if that was case you would feel a terrible performance on the overall system use
Which is indeed not the case....
